content.protection: Two or three pads. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Warm Up Boulder.

content.description: Start in an iffy hueco, and pull up and around the lip of the arete. It is fun and a good warm-up if you're heading up to the main area.
content.location: This is along the trail, about 50 feet from the fence at the pullout.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the arete with a right hand on a horizontal crimp and a left hand on an in-cut sidepull.  From there, high-step up the featured, eastern side of the arete, and finish up the slab.
content.location: This ascends Pullout Boulder's east arete.

content.description:
Stand start at arete to the right of

Mr. Warmup

.  Start with right hand on arete, right foot on good foothold, left and hand on undercling, and left foot toehooking that undercling.  From there, moving in seqeunce to keep your balance is the key. Early on, that requires a fair amount of repositioning. Working upward will require some good smearig at times. The topout has a nice lip but looks as if it could break if you pull in wrong spot. I had one hold break near the top and had a nice fall.
content.protection: Pad, spotter.  It has a good landing, but watch the holds at the top.
content.location:
This is on the Pullout Boulder right of

Mr. Warmup

.

content.description: Sit with a questionable, incut flake-hueco or a hand on the arete. From there, reach a left hand edge, follow to a right hand gaston, gain the lip, go back to the arete with the right, walk the feet over to a heel hook, mantel on the slab, and reach the top for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Warm Up Boulder.
